properties.description: A place to enjoy a hot drink, breakfast rolls and later soup and toasties. We have newspapers, games and activities. Donations welcome
properties.title: Greenock Salvation Army Community Cafe

properties.address: New Parish Church Port Glasgow, Port Glasgow, Inverclyde PA14 5JD
properties.description: This is a social enterprise project which offers hot food and a warm, safe environment to all members of the community. It is a pay what you can and offers home made soup, toasties, cake and tea for a minimal cost
properties.title: New Parish Church Port Glasgow Chatty Cafe

properties.description: Expect a friendly welcome and warm space. There is free Wi-Fi access and People’s Network computers available for use. Study tables are also available. Join in the jigsaw swap or pull up a chair at the activity table. Activities and games are suitable for ages 0-100+. Please note that library opening times are subject to change at short notice – please contact us for more information. Tel: 01436 658767.
properties.title: Cardross Library

properties.description: The Village Hub is a community run café to provide a meeting place on a Monday and Wednesday from 10am to 2pm open to the whole community. They provide home baking and beverages in the morning and at lunchtime home-made soup and sandwiches. Small charge/donations welcome.
properties.title: Cardross Church Halls

properties.description: Providing a warm hub and a free bowl of soup.
properties.title: Lennox Evangelical Church

properties.description: Donation café – pay what you can.

hours._text: Tuesday Morning Breakfast Club; Wednesday and Thursday Lunch Club midday - 1.30pm

properties.title: Phoenix
